Diagnosis
	1. Muscle invasive bladder cancer with liver and lung metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	April 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Transurethral resection of bladder tumor (TURBT) 12 April 2024

	Chemotherapy
	Cycle 1-2 Gemcitabine/Cisplatin completed May 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new liver lesions

	Current issues
	Worsening renal function, increasing pain, deteriorating performance status

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at Urology MDT today. This 68-year-old gentleman was diagnosed with muscle-invasive bladder cancer in April 2024 following investigation of frank hematuria. Initial staging showed a large bladder tumor with local invasion into perivesical fat, regional lymphadenopathy, and multiple liver and lung metastases. HER2 testing on the TURBT specimen was positive (IHC 3+).

He commenced palliative chemotherapy with Gemcitabine/Cisplatin but recent CT after cycle 2 shows disease progression with 30% increase in liver metastases and new peritoneal deposits. His performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 2-3, with increasing right upper quadrant pain requiring opioid escalation. His renal function has declined with creatinine rising from 120 to 180 μmol/L.

The MDT recommendations are:
1. Discontinue current chemotherapy due to disease progression and declining performance status
2. Switch to second-line treatment with Enfortumab Vedotin given HER2 positivity
3. Urgent palliative medicine review for pain management
4. Consider palliative radiotherapy to symptomatic pelvic disease

	Further investigations
	Repeat renal function in 1 week prior to new treatment

	Medication prescribed
	Oxycodone MR increased to 40mg BD
Pregabalin 75mg BD started for neuropathic pain component

	Follow up
	Urgent review in oncology clinic next week
Palliative care review arranged for tomorrow

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function weekly
Increase community support given declining performance status
